scenario:
The global adhesives and adhesive-applying equipment market is expected to grow from $72.1 billion in 2024 to $89.9 billion by 2029 at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 4.5%. The market is driven by increasing demand for adhesives in the packaging and transportation industries, surge in demand across footwear, furniture, and appliance industries, and growing demand for automated and robotic adhesive equipment. The market is segmented by curing techniques, technologies, chemicals, and end uses for adhesives, and by types and end users for adhesive-applying equipment. The report highlights market dynamics, manufacturers, ESG developments, and competitive landscapes, providing regional analyses for North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, and the Rest of the World.

Key drivers of the market include:

- Increasing demand for adhesives in packaging and transportation industries
- Surge in demand across footwear, furniture, and appliance industries
- Growing demand for automated and robotic adhesive equipment
- Increasing demand for bio-based adhesives
- Customizable and OEM equipment and machines for adhesives

The market is dominated by the packaging segment, which is expected to continue to dominate the market by the end of 2029. Asia-Pacific holds the largest market share due to the extensive presence of players in this region and the high demand for automotive and electronics applications.

Market leaders include 3M, ARKEMA, AVERY DENNISON CORP., BASF, DELO INDUSTRIE KLEBSTOFFE GMBH & CO. KGAA, DOW, GLUE MACHINERY CORP., GRACO INC., H.B. FULLER CO., HENKEL AG & CO. KGAA, ITW DYNATEC, NORDSON CORP., ROBATECH AG, SIKA AG, VALCO MELTON, and WACKER CHEMIE AG.

The report provides regional analyses for North America, Europe, Asia-Pacific, and the Rest of the World, and highlights market dynamics, manufacturers, ESG developments, and competitive landscapes.
